dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, I heard, like, all foreign aid is getting a massive boost right now, total, like, unprecedented increase across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, I heard, like, all foreign aid is getting a massive boost right now, total, like, unprecedented increase across the board.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A list of grants from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) for which funding has been terminated has been published... By the way, the United States has officially canceled 83% of USAID programs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, actually, that's... that's not quite right. It's kinda the opposite, actually. USAID, um, they've published a list of grants where funding has just been terminated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, actually, that's... that's not quite right. It's kinda the opposite, actually. U S A I D, um, they've published a list of grants where funding has just been terminated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A list of grants from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) for which funding has been terminated has been published, according to Punchbowl News.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Terminated? Really? What, like, one or two small things, or...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Terminated? Really? What, like, one or two small things, or...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, Punchbowl News reported it. And, um, contracts in Central Asia, like Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan, they've been canceled, too. As of March 5th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, Punchbowl News reported it. And, um, contracts in Central Asia, like Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan, they've been canceled, too. As of March fifth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A list of grants from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) for which funding has been terminated has been published, according to Punchbowl News. According to the document, as of March 5, contracts have also been canceled in Central Asia, including Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Central Asia? Why there? Are we just, like, pulling out of everything now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Central Asia? Why there? Are we just, like, pulling out of everything now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, two specific contracts in Kazakhstan, anyway. One was for $2.350 million. The other was, um, $3.350 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, two specific contracts in Kazakhstan, anyway. One was for two point three five dollars0 million. The other was, um, three point three five dollars0 million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The information indicates that the amounts of two contracts related to the implementation of projects in Kazakhstan were $2.350 million and $3.350 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Two million? What on earth were they spending six million dollars on in Kazakhstan? Like, building a new national monument?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two million? What on earth were they spending six million dollars on in Kazakhstan? Like, building a new national monument?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The first one was, uh, for "Strengthening Civic Participation in Kazakhstan."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The first one was, uh, for Strengthening Civic Participation in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first amount was related to funding a project on the topic of "Strengthening Civic Participation in Kazakhstan."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, 'civic participation,' whatever that even means. Just, like, encouraging people to vote, maybe? Sounds... vague.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, 'civic participation,' whatever that even means. Just, like, encouraging people to vote, maybe? Sounds... vague.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the second one, the larger one, that was for "Strengthening Human Rights and Equality." Specifically, uh, it was to strengthen the capacity of LGBT organizations there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the second one, the larger one, that was for Strengthening Human Rights and Equality. Specifically, uh, it was to strengthen the capacity of L G B T organizations there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The second funding was intended to implement the goal of "Strengthening Human Rights and Equality," which was "to strengthen the capacity of LGBT organizations in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan to advocate sustainably and safely for the full recognition and respect of the human rights of LGBT people and all people."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, LGBT organizations? In Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan? We're spending millions of taxpayer dollars on that? Seriously?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, L G B T organizations? In Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan? We're spending millions of taxpayer dollars on that? Seriously?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the goal was to, uh, help them advocate sustainably and safely for human rights, you know, for LGBT people and all people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the goal was to, uh, help them advocate sustainably and safely for human rights, you know, for L G B T people and all people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "The overarching goal is to strengthen the ability of LGBT organizations to sustainably and safely advocate for the full recognition of and respect for the human rights of LGBT and all persons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But is that... is that really what our core national interest is, though? Like, spending millions overseas on that specific kind of advocacy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But is that... is that really what our core national interest is, though? Like, spending millions overseas on that specific kind of advocacy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Marco Rubio, he reported that, um, 83% of USAID programs have been canceled. And he said the 200 contracts canceled, they spent "tens of billions of dollars in ways that did not serve, and in some cases harmed, the core national interests of the United States."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Marco Rubio, he reported that, um, eighty three percent of U S A I D programs have been canceled. And he said the two hundred contracts canceled, they spent tens of billions of dollars in ways that did not serve, and in some cases harmed, the core national interests of the United States.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the way, the United States has officially canceled 83% of USAID programs. Secretary of State Marco Rubio reported that the 200 contracts that were canceled "spent tens of billions of dollars in ways that did not serve, and in some cases harmed, the core national interests of the United States."

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: See? That's exactly what I'm talking about. Tens of billions. Unbelievable.
